name: DIFFERENCE AND REPETITION > LIMINAL ARTIFACTS (CODE) #4
description:
A two decade long project, inspired by Deleuze, to mimic systems of growth and evolution via the steady, patient accumulation of error. 

One line is placed - the following line then attempts to as closely mimic the previous as possible, including the imperfections. In the Liminal Artifacts series, this process is attempted with code by Liam Egan, extracted as .PNG’s, used as alpha image planes in Blender, then lit with a single light source. 

A machine attempting to mimic a human mimicking a machine and ending in purgatory.
